MAPPING.DESCRIPTION: --04/10/2016 made an update to this mapping to include 2 new fields(INV_ID,RPT_ID) to param table as part of ITPR017177 Rebates Copy/Void Rewrite
MAPPING.NAME: m_CASH_Create_ParmFile_Recn_Load

TRANSFORMATION.DESCRIPTION: -- adding INV_ID and RPT_ID to RCNT_RECN_PARAM as part as ITPR017177 Rebates Copy/Void Rewrite
TRANSFORMATION.NAME: SQ_RCNT_RECN_HDR

TRANSFORMFIELD.DESCRIPTION: A system generated unique identifier for each data harvest process, using seque
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: HVST_ID1

TABLEATTRIBUTE.NAME: Sql Query
TABLEATTRIBUTE.VALUE: SELECT X.RECN_GID, X.INV_ID, -- adding as part of ITPR017177 Rebates Copy/Void Rewrite X.RPT_ID, -- adding as part of ITPR017177 Rebates Copy/Void Rewrite X.HVST_ID, X.MODEL_TYP_CD, X.PERIOD_ID, X.PERIOD_BEGIN_DT, X.PERIOD_END_DT, PERIOD.APC_STAT_CD, X.DISCNT_RUN_MODE_CD FROM VRAP.TDISCNT_PERIOD PERIOD, ( SELECT RCHDR.RECN_GID, INVHD.INV_ID, INVDT.RPT_ID, INVDT.HVST_ID, INVDT.MODEL_TYP_CD, DP.PERIOD_ID, DP.PERIOD_BEGIN_DT, DP.PERIOD_END_DT, DP.PERIOD_PARENT_ID, HQUE.DISCNT_RUN_MODE_CD FROM VRAP.TDISCNT_PERIOD DP, VRAP.RCNT_RBAT_MFG_INV_HDR INVHD, VRAP.RCNT_RBAT_MFG_INV_DTL INVDT, VRAP.RCNT_RECN_HDR RCHDR, VRAP.THARVEST_QUE HQUE WHERE RCHDR.RECN_GID = INVHD.RECN_GID AND RCHDR.RBAT_RPT_PRD_ID = DP.PERIOD_ID AND INVHD.INV_ID = INVDT.INV_ID AND INVHD.INV_STAT_CD = 1 AND INVDT.HVST_ID = HQUE.HVST_ID AND INVHD.RECN_GID IN (SELECT DISTINCT RECN_GID FROM VRAP.RCNT_RECN_HDR RHDIN WHERE RHDIN.RECN_STAT_CD = $$PARM_RECN_STAT AND RHDIN.RBAT_RPT_PRD_ID IN (SELECT RBAT_RPT_PRD_ID FROM VRAP.RCNT_RECN_HDR INNERRCHDR WHERE INNERRCHDR.RECN_STAT_CD = $$PARM_RECN_STAT ORDER BY INNERRCHDR.RECN_GID FETCH FIRST 1 ROW ONLY ) FETCH FIRST $$PARM_NUM_RECN ROWS ONLY ) ) X WHERE PERIOD.PERIOD_ID = COALESCE(X.PERIOD_PARENT_ID, X.PERIOD_ID) ORDER BY X.RECN_GID WITH UR; --SQL Override

INSTANCE.DESCRIPTION: -- adding INV_ID and RPT_ID to RCNT_RECN_PARAM as part as ITPR017177 Rebates Copy/Void Rewrite
INSTANCE.NAME: SQ_RCNT_RECN_HDR

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This parm is used to determine the number of recons to be processed for each run of the loader
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$PARM_NUM_RECN

MAPPINGVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: This parm is used to pass in status code of either [NEW] or [Copy-Void] for the loader parm file creation.
MAPPINGVARIABLE.NAME: $$PARM_RECN_STAT

SHORTCUT.COMMENTS: This table is used to drive the Harvest Java batch process. Entries are made by the Actuate program when a report is run. Data is copied from temporary tables to permanent ones.
SHORTCUT.NAME: THARVEST_QUE

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Maximum Memory Allowed For Auto Memory Attributes
Maximum Percentage of Total Memory Allowed For Auto Memory Attributes
Additional Concurrent Pipelines for Lookup Cache Creation
Save session log for these runs
Session Log File Max Time Period

SESSION.DESCRIPTION: This session creates a parameter file for subsequent workflows. Target RCNT_RECN_HDR has post-sql to truncate the staging table.
SESSION.NAME: s_m_CASH_Create_ParmFile_Recn_Load

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Save session log for these runs
Email Text
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE:
ONCALL: This is a recurring job and will execute again in 30 mins, if there are new/copyvoid reconciliations to process. Please check the workflow name to determine if it was a NEW/CopyVoid reconcilition. Possible issues could be related to the environment or the Reconciliation header tables.
The mapping %m ran in the %s session in the %w workflow ran in %d.
Target Table: %t
%l
%r
Session Log is attached %g

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Write Backward Compatible Session Log File
Allow Pushdown for User Incompatible Connections

SESSION.DESCRIPTION: Runs a query to determine if there are any reconciliations with a status of 2 [running] - Due to an earlier failed load. Updates the reconciliation status from LOADING to ERROR.
SESSION.NAME: s_m_CASH_Error_RecnGIDs

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Email Subject
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE: FAILURE: Recon Load - Error recon check failed %d

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Email Text
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE:
ONCALL: This is a recurring job and will execute again in 30 mins,only if there are new/copyvoid reconciliations to process. Please check the workflow name to determine if it was a NEW/CopyVoid reconcilition. Possible issues could be related to the environment or the Reconciliation header table. Please run a query against VRAP.RCNT_RECN_HDR to validate there are no issues with the table.
The mapping %m ran in the %s session in the %w workflow ran in %d.
Target Table: %t
%l
%r
Session Log is attached %g

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Write Backward Compatible Session Log File
Allow Pushdown for User Incompatible Connections

TRANSFORMFIELD.EXPRESSION: iif(isnull(RowData),'',abort('Error Recon GIDs from previous runs'))
TRANSFORMFIELD.NAME: abort

SESSION.DESCRIPTION: This is dummy session to send out an email with a list of the bad reconciliations. If there are bad recons, this session will be forced to fail and send out a list of bad recons as an email attachment, but will NOT fail the workflow.
SESSION.NAME: s_m_CASH_Email_Error_GIDs

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Email Text
ATTRIBUTE.VALUE:
%a<$PMTargetFileDir/Recn_Error_RecnGids.dat>
Recons with RECN_STAT_CD in RUNNING status were found - This is a result of previous errors while loading these recons. Status on these recons have been reset to ERROR. Please find attached a file with these reconciliation GIDs. Please investigate.
ONCALL: This does not stop us from processing other recons. The process runs every 30 mins and will pick up any new/copyvoid recons.
The %m mapping ran in the %s session in the %w workflow ran on %d.

ATTRIBUTE.NAME: Write Backward Compatible Session Log File
Allow Pushdown for User Incompatible Connections

WORKFLOWVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Error message for this task's execution

WORKFLOWVARIABLE.NAME: $Start.ErrorMsg

WORKFLOWVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Status of the previous task that is not disabled
WORKFLOWVARIABLE.NAME: $s_m_CASH_Email_Error_RecnGIDs.PrevTaskStatus

WORKFLOWVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Error code for this task's execution

WORKFLOWVARIABLE.DESCRIPTION: Error message for this task's execution
